title: Addresses - Enterprise Addressing System
description: Note 3/13/2024: This data pipeline was recently updated. If you notice any issues, please email support@datasf.org, or fill out the form located at Actions->Contact dataset owner. Active base addresses from San Francisco's Enterprise Addressing System (EAS). This dataset does not include sub-addresses, such as units, and does not include a block/lot value for each record. For units and block/lot values, see the "Addresses with Units - Enterprise Addressing System" dataset. Note: this dataset now includes as of 12/17/2020, base addresses that may not have any block/lot value associated.

columns.name: EAS BaseID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the base address record. For example, the address excluding any sub-units

columns.name: Address
columns.description: The full location of a record often including the street number, name and type; city; state; and zip code

columns.name: Address Number
columns.description: The numeric identifier for a land parcel, house, building, or other location along a thoroughfare or within a community

columns.name: Address Number Suffix
columns.description: The portion of the Complete Address Number that follows the Address Number itself if one exists

columns.name: Street Name
columns.description: The portion of the Complete Street Name that identifies the particular thoroughfare

columns.name: Street Type
columns.description: A word or phrase that follows the Street Name and identifies a type of thoroughfare in a Complete Street Name

columns.name: ZIP Code
columns.description: A system of 5-digit codes that identifies the individual Post Office or metropolitan area delivery station associated with an address.

columns.name: CNN
columns.description: Centerline Network Number is the primary key/identifier for a street segment or node assigned by the Department of Public Works in the city's official basemap. Segments refer to lines representing the street, nodes represent points where two or more segments intersect. CNN IDs are often found encoded as text (CNNTEXT) or numbers (CNN). Basemap street segments are available here: https://data.sfgov.org/d/7hfy-8sz8; Basemap intersections (nodes) are here: https://data.sfgov.org/d/ctsg-7znq

columns.name: Longitude
columns.description: A geographic coordinate expressed in decimal degrees that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface and assuming a WGS84 coordinate system.

columns.name: Latitude
columns.description: A geographic coordinate expressed in decimal degrees that specifies the north-south position of a point on the Earth's surface and assuming a WGS84 coordinate system.

columns.name: point
columns.description: The system representation of the coordinate (latitude and longitude) for the purposes of mapping within the open data portal.

columns.name: supdist
columns.description: Full name of Supervisorial District

columns.name: supervisor
columns.description: Supervisor District Number

columns.name: supdistpad
columns.description: Supervisor District Number as text with zero padding (01, 02, ...)

columns.name: numbertext
columns.description: Supervisor District number as text (ONE, TWO, ...)

columns.name: supname
columns.description: Last name of current Supervisor for District

columns.name: nhood
columns.description: San Francisco Neighborhood as per DataSF.

columns.name: complete_landmark_name
columns.description: Landmark name for a base address, if associated.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp the data was updated in the source system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp the data was loaded to the open data portal
